items.title: Rode Ster-baas geeft Arnautovic draai om de oren
items.summary: Hij werd afgelopen zomer met klaroengeschal welkom geheten door Rode Ster Belgrado , maar halverwege het seizoen is de leiding van de Servische topclub niet zo tevreden over Marko Arnautovic.

items.title: Hadj Moussa bij eerste basisplaats op Afrika Cup van grote waarde
items.summary: Anis Hadj Moussa heeft zichzelf woensdag in de kijker gespeeld op het toernooi om de Afrika Cup. De rechtsbuiten van Feyenoord was namens het al gekwalificeerde Algerije met twee assists belangrijk in het afsluitende groepsduel met Equatoriaal-Guinea.

items.title: Madrid's MbappÃ© (knee) doubtful for Supercopa
items.summary: Kylian MbappÃ© will miss Real Madrid's LaLiga game with Real Betis and is a doubt for next week's Spanish Supercopa, sources have told ESPN, due to a knee injury.

items.title: Modric: Mourinho at Madrid 'made Ronaldo cry'
items.summary: Croatia and AC Milan midfielder Luka Modric said on Wednesday that Jose Mourinho was such a tough manager during their time at Real Madrid that he once reduced star player Cristiano Ronaldo to tears.

items.title: Madrid great Roberto Carlos has heart surgery
items.summary: Brazil and Real Madrid legend Roberto Carlos confirmed on Wednesday that he underwent a "preventive" heart procedure, but clarified that he did not suffer a heart attack and that he is "doing well" while recovering in a hospital in SÃ£o Paulo.

items.title: Transferdeadlines Eredivisie en topcompetities: wanneer opent en sluit de markt?
items.summary: Het seizoen is halverwege en dat houdt in dat clubs de kans krijgen om tussentijds spelers te kopen en/of verkopen. De transferwindow opent begin januari 2026 en duurt een maand. Een overzicht van de transferwindows in de Eredivisie, Premier League, Serie A, La Liga, Bundesliga en Ligue 1.

items.title: Not just results - why Maresca is under pressure
items.summary: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca needs results to improve but issues off the pitch are adding to the pressure, BBC Sport's Nizaar Kinsella explains.

items.title: Everton wrongly denied penalty in Arsenal loss, says panel
items.summary: Everton should have been awarded a penalty in their 1-0 defeat by Arsenal, the Premier League's Key Match Incidents Panel has said.

items.title: Maresca in danger of losing Chelsea job if results do not improve in January
items.summary: Enzo Maresca will have to improve results at Chelsea quickly if he wants to keep his job after a run of one win in seven Premier League games.

items.title: Loughnane chalks up record-breaking 222nd win of the year
items.summary: Billy Loughnane broke the 21st century record for winners in a calendar year after he registered his 222nd success on Invited at Lingfield Park on New Yearâ€™s Eve.

items.title: 'Are you sure?' - Guardiola questions two-horse race
items.summary: Pep Guardiola has questioned whether the Premier League title race this season is a two-horse race between his Manchester City side and leaders Arsenal.

items.title: Slot sees positives as Frimpong and Kerkez adapt to end of a full-back era
items.summary: Liverpool head coachâ€™s new full-backs have struggled Slot expects improvement as squad and signings settle Arne Slot has said Liverpool remain â€œa work in progressâ€ in both full-back positions but backed Jeremie Frimpong and Milos Kerkez to make their mark as his team stabilise. Slot admits Liverpool are still adjusting to the end of the Trent Alexander-Arnold and Andy Robertson era with injuries and disruption limiting the impact of their designated successors, including Conor Bradley. Frimpong has improved since returning from his second hamstring injury of the season, however, and provided assists for Hugo EkitikÃ© and Ryan Gravenberch in the recent victories over Tottenham and Wolves. Slot believes the summer signings Frimpong and Kerkez, from Bayer Leverkusen and Bournemouth respectively, will prove valuable assets for Liverpool, with their pace essential for the modern game. Continue reading...

items.title: Masters Snooker 2026: Draw and schedule as Murphy aims to defend title
items.summary: The 2026 edition of snooker's Masters runs from January 11-18 at London's Alexandra Palace with Shaun Murphy the defending champion and Ronnie O'Sullivan a star attraction.

items.title: Darke's Premier League flops so far: Isak, Sesko, Gittens lead the way
items.summary: We've covered the team of the season so far, but how about the flip side? Ian Darke picks out those struggling stars -- like Alexander Isak, who had struggled for form and fitness even before his injury.

items.title: Wolves draw sums up Man Utd's year: Hope followed by howlers
